page.title: 07Nurseries 2
page.content: Those working full-time work from 7am to 4pm and have 4 weeks holiday a year. They work a 5 day week. They use 100-150 grammes of tomato seeds a year and the{tomatoes}take approximately 11 months to grow. About 120 tonnes of fruit are produced per acre. They have a special watering device called a trickle waterer. It is a little pipe attached to a large pipe which drips water every few seconds. Machines are now used to grade the tomatoes into different sizes;before, they used cardboard with holes cut out. Each box has the size of tomatoes stamped on it, the most common size being 47-57mm. They keep a record of what they grow and turn the heating off during hot days. They have adapted with the times, originally growing {strawberries}which eventually suffered the disastrous effect of{red core}.
